content.text:
------------------------------------------------------------------
                      Overview (Please Read)
------------------------------------------------------------------
This is an acoustic guitar arrangement for the song Let It Go, from Disney's Frozen. 
This arrangement was made because of the difficulty of transposing an orchestral 
score to acoustic guitar, and combines parts unique to the soundtrack version with
parts unique to the single (Demi Lovato) version. Some chords had to be changed 
because the two versions are in different keys. This arrangement uses the original
soundtrack key of A flat major (starting in the relative minor). Like most songs 
that use a capo, these chords are transcribed by the chord shape, not the chord sound.
That is, despite fingering a G chord, you're actually play Ab.

------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------PLEASE NOTE----------------------------
-   This arrangement is different then any recorded versions     -
-                    and is intended to be                       -
-          Please do not comment about any inaccuracies          -
-              compared to either recorded versions              -      
------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------
                         Chords and Tuning
------------------------------------------------------------------
Key of Ab Major

Standard Tuning
Capo on 1

Chord Shapes

[ch]G[/ch] (320033)
[ch]D[/ch] (xx0232)
[ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch] (200233)
[ch]C[/ch] (x32010
[ch]Cadd9[/ch] (x32033)
[ch]Em[/ch] (022000)
[ch]Em7[/ch] (022033)
[ch]A[/ch] (x02220)
[ch]Am[/ch] (x02210)
[ch]Asus4[/ch] (x02230)
[ch]G/B[/ch]  (x20033)
[ch]Gm/Bb[/ch] (x10033)
[ch]Cadd2[/ch] (x32030)


-------------------------------------------------------------------
                             Let It Go
-------------------------------------------------------------------


[Verse 1]

    [ch]Em[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]                      [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]Asus4[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
The snow glows white on the mountain tonight not a footprint to be seen
  [ch]Em[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]Asus4[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch]
A kingdom of isolation and it looks like I'm the queen          
[ch]Em[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]Asus4[/ch]    [ch]Am[/ch]
The wind is howling like this swirling storm inside
[ch]Em[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]                     [ch]A[/ch]
Couldn't keep it in, heaven knows I've tried

                    
[Pre-chorus 1]
[ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]C[/ch]
Don't let them in, don't let them see
                                    [ch]D[/ch]
Be the good girl you always have to be
                                    [ch]C[/ch]
Conceal, don't feel, don't let them know
               [ch]Cadd2[/ch]
Well, now they know


[Chorus 1]
 
       [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]
Let it go, let it go
      [ch]Em7[/ch]             [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
Can't hold it back anymore  
       [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]
Let it go, let it go 
      [ch]Em7[/ch]              [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
Turn away and slam the door
[ch]G[/ch]       [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]          [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
I don't care what they're going to say
        [ch]G/B[/ch]       [ch]Gm/Bb[/ch]
Let the storm rage on
    [ch]C[/ch]
The cold never bothered me anyway


[Break]*

[ch]G[/ch]   [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]


[Verse 2]

[ch]Em[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]Am[/ch]
  It's funny how some distance makes everything seem small
        [ch]Em[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]A[/ch]
And the fears that once controlled me can't get to me at all
[ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]
Up here in the cold thin air I finally can breathe
  [ch]Em[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]
I know I left a life behind but I'm too relieved to grieve


[Pre-chorus 2]

[ch]D[/ch]                            [ch]C[/ch]
 It's time to see what I can do
                             [ch]D[/ch]  
To test the limits and break through
                                 [ch]C[/ch]
No right, no wrong, no rules for me
    [ch]Cadd2[/ch]
I'm free


[Chorus 2]
 
       [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]
Let it go, let it go
     [ch]Em7[/ch]          [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
I am one with the wind and sky  
       [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]
Let it go, let it go 
      [ch]Em7[/ch]           [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
You'll never see me cry
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]     [ch]Em7[/ch]       [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
Here I stand and     here I'll stay
        [ch]G/B[/ch]        [ch]Gm/Bb[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]
Let the storm rage on        


[Bridge]

[ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]    [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
Standing   frozen      in the life I've chosen
[ch]G[/ch]         [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]    [ch]Em7[/ch]         [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
You won't find me,     the past is far behind me
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Em[/ch]      [ch]C[/ch]
 Buried in the snow


[Bridge 2]**

[ch]C[/ch]
My power flurries through the air into the ground
[ch]C[/ch]
My soul is spiraling in frozen fractals all around
[ch]D[/ch]
And one thought crystallizes like an icy blast
[ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]Am[/ch]  [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
I'm never going back, the past is in the past


[Chorus 3]


       [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]
Let it go, let it go
         [ch]Em7[/ch]           [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
And I'll rise like the break of dawn
[ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch] 
Let it go, let it go
     [ch]Em7[/ch]             [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
That perfect girl is gone
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]Dadd11/F#[/ch]    [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]Cadd9[/ch]
Here I stand in the light of day
        [ch]G/B[/ch]        [ch]Gm/Bb[/ch]       
Let the storm rage on        
[ch]C[/ch]
The cold never bothered me anyway



------------------------------------------------------------------
                              Notes
------------------------------------------------------------------

*The break is just two measures, play it the same way you'd play the first 
line of the chorus, but where the second line of the chorus would start, 
begin the second verse. It takes some practice to get the timing right, 
but it should sync up with the recorded Idina Menzel version still at that 
point, so you can listen to it for timing. It's when the orchestral strings 
come in.

**The first three lines of the second bridge (which is the second half of 
the bridge from the original recording) sound better with power chords or
5 chords. The fingerings for these are: C (x355xx) and D (x577xx). 
Additionally, this arrangement is structured in a way that you could drop 
the entire second bridge, if you so choose, but it adds tension and 
complexity to the final third of the song.

Finally, in almost the entire song the Dadd11/F# chord can either be replaced 
by a normal D chord (Chorus) or a Dsus4 chord (all other times). The fingering
is: Dsus4 (xx0233).

(Not to be confused with the Demi Lovato version which is quite different)

For Bassist and Piano/Strings players who don't really know what to do about music

or for multiple guitar arrangements.

Original Guitar Tab by: MySoapBox

Transposed by: luke.hedt
Used with permission

Standard Tuning

Top line is the bass line, the lower line is the chord line 
(minors, etc. Bass can't really distinguish them unless you are playing a really good riff).
This is in original key of what I think is A-flat-maj, rather then the G-maj version for guitar on Capo 1.

Song: Let It Go

Published by Wonderland Music Company, Inc. (BMI)

The following is an interpretation of "Let It Go" by me.

CAPO - Fret 1.
If you don't have a capo, you can still play this. It will just sound lower.
OR you can be like me and tune every single string to one fret higher.
I tried to place the chords where they actually happen, but I mean it's best to 
learn the timing of the chords by listening to the song.

(I put optional stuff in parenthesis for more completion)

(Also, during the long string of C's and D's before the climax, feel free to change it up by
mixing some
x     x
3     x
2     0
0 and 2
0     2
0     2
     into the solo.)

Have fun :o

    [ch]Fm[/ch]                      [ch]Db[/ch]

 not a footprint to be seen.

[ch]Fm[/ch]            [ch]Db[/ch]             [ch]Eb[/ch]               [ch]Bbm[/ch]

[ch]Fm[/ch]                [ch]Db[/ch]                 [ch]Bb[/ch]

[ch]Eb[/ch]                                 [ch]Db[/ch]/[ch]Bbm[/ch]
 Don't let them in, don't let them see.
                                     [ch]Eb[/ch]

                [ch]Db[/ch]

       [ch]Ab[/ch]         [ch]Eb[/ch]
Let it go, let it go!

 Can't hold it back any more.
        [ch]Ab[/ch]         [ch]Eb[/ch]

[ch]Eb[/ch]                           [ch]Db[/ch]/[ch]Bbm[/ch]

                              [ch]Eb[/ch]    
 to test the limits and break through.

      [ch]Db[/ch]
 I'm free!

[Chorus 2]

Let it go, let it go.
      [ch]Fm[/ch]                    [ch]Db[/ch]
 I am one with the wind and sky.
        [ch]Ab[/ch]         [ch]Eb[/ch]
 Let it go, let it go.

 [ch]Ab[/ch]         [ch]Eb[/ch]        [ch]Fm[/ch]        [ch]Db[/ch]

[ch]Fm[/ch]         [ch]Db[/ch]              [ch]Eb[/ch]             [ch]Bbm[/ch]

[Chorus 3]
       [ch]Ab[/ch]         [ch]Eb[/ch]
Let it go, let it go.
          [ch]Fm[/ch]                     [ch]Db[/ch]
 And I'll rise like the break of dawn. 
        [ch]Ab[/ch]         [ch]Eb[/ch]
 Let it go, let it go
      [ch]Fm[/ch]              [ch]Db[/ch]

        [ch]Cm[/ch]    [ch]Cm[/ch]/[ch]Bbm[/ch]  [ch]Cm/Ab[/ch]
Let the storm rage     on!
     [ch]Db[/ch]

#################################################################################
#                          DO NOT REMOVE FROM DOCUMENT!                         #
#################################################################################

Author's Notes:

If you wanna use this file in its entirety, or just as individual songs, make sure
to include my name on it somewhere. I worked hard on these so you could use them for
free. Don't plagiarize.

This text file is broken down as follows: songs are separated by a "____" At the
beginning of each song, I've defined all the chords that will be used, and to what
they will be referred. For example:

F:                        F(2):
e|-----|                  e|-----|
B|-----|                  B|-----|
G|-----|                  G|--10-|
D|--3--|                  D|--10-|
A|--3--|                  A|--8--|
E|--1--|                  E|-----|

means that wherever "F" occurs in the song, play it on the 6th string, and wherever
"F(2)" occurs, play it on the 5th string. The reason for this seems obvious to me, but
I kinda have to explain it because 99% of the internet is retarded: the purpose is each
chord, "F" and "F(2)" are both technically of the fifth form (F5), the only difference
being that F(2) is one octave higher than F. So in a song where there is an F played on
the 6th string, then later, an F is played on the 5th string, the two must somehow be
differentiated or else it will sound weird when the reader attempts to play it. Duh.

Anyhow, I chose this method over tabbing the chords over and over throughout the song
because it keeps things nice and neat. I also tried to place the chord changes over the
lyrics as accurately as possible, but it's not precise. It shouldn't need to be anyhow;
music is all vibes. Get a feel for the song and the chord changes should come naturally,
as should the rhythm. Practice makes perfect!

If you find any major errors or what-not, feel free to send me an e-mail. Chances are, I
won't respond if you have a minor variation to a solo or a lyric. If you're good enough to
hear what I can't, then you don't really need this file, do you? Leave me alone. If, on the
other hand, there's some outrageous mistake, let me know. I'll be cool about it.

So, that's it. Until
next time, kiddies - rock on!

                        --== Jesus of Suburbia ==--

Notes:

This song is complicated yet simple; the chord structure is
characteristically Green Day in that there are very few chords played in
different patterns for the verse, pre-chorus, chorus, etc. Where it differs
from their other songs, however, is its dramatic shifts in style and tone
throughout. Incidentally, the song is nearly 10 minutes long, comparable in
length to rock operas like "Stairway to Heaven" and "Bohemian Rhapsody."

To date, this is Green Day's only rock opera (with the possible exception of
"Homecoming," another track on this album).

Consequently, I've broken it down into component parts, each part denoting a
shift in style or tone; these are denoted by "PART" and then a roman numeral
designating the part of the song.

Well, that's the complete album. I hope it helps those of you who like
Green Day enough to emulate them via your guitar. Special thanks go out
to Mike Fireball & Brian Grey for getting me the cd, greendayauthority.com
for most of the lyrics and to reizig for the parts of "Letterbomb" I borrowed
from his tab. And of course, Green Day!

                        --== Jesus of Suburbia ==--

Notes:

This song is complicated yet simple; the chord structure is
characteristically Green Day in that there are very few chords played in
different patterns for the verse, pre-chorus, chorus, etc. Where it differs
from their other songs, however, is its dramatic shifts in style and tone 
throughout. Incidentally, the song is nearly 10 minutes long, comparable in 
length to rock operas like "Stairway to Heaven" and "Bohemian Rhapsody."

To date, this is Green Day's only rock opera (with the possible exception of 
"Homecoming," another track on this album). 

Consequently, I've broken it down into component parts, each part denoting a 
shift in style or tone; these are denoted by "PART" and then a roman numeral
designating the part of the song.

Peace, love, and soul,
